intro: Pandanus hermesii, commonly known as the Hermes’ pandanus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Pandanaceae. It is native to the island of Socotra, located in the Arabian Sea. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, feather-like leaves that are often used in traditional crafts. It produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by edible, fibrous fruits. Pandanus hermesii thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to the unique climate of Socotra.
